DataElement.preferredDefinition: the exent of nodal involvement of bladder cancer as determined prior to treatment based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters (physcial examination, imaging, endoscopy, biopsy, surgical exploration, etc.).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the clinical N stage of a bladder tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A distensible musculomembranous organ serving as a receptacle for fluid, as the gallbladder.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/9/17 tt transferred context/BC; added Reg Status.  Updated to use Property based on NCIt concept

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the N (nodal) stage of a bladder tumor, as defined by the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, 6th Ed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with no regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer cN0 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with no regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: METASTASIS IN A SINGLE LYMPH NODE, MORE THAN 2 CM BUT NOT MORE THAN 5 CM IN GREATEST DIMENSION; OR MULTIPLE LYMPH NODES, NONE MORE THAN 5 CM IN GREATEST DIMENSION

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: METASTASIS IN A LYMPH NODE MORE THAN 5 CM IN GREATEST DIMENSION

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
